laboratory_examinations.findings: Grew methicillin-susceptible Staphylococcus aureus, Moraxella catarrhalis, Haemophilus influenzae, and Streptococcus pneumoniae.
A large pleural effusion on the right side with underlying pneumonia and air-space opacification in the right lower lung zone.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Seven months prior showed clear lungs and no pleural effusion; Admission radiographs showed dense opacification and a large pleural effusion.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Hematocrit was normal; white-cell count was 11,500 (outside normal range), elevated neutrophils (73%), thrombocytosis (891,000), elevated C-reactive protein (217.2 mg/liter).

Histopathological examination showed an abscess with purulent inflammation surrounded by granulomatous inflammation and fibrosis, with a sulfur granule and filamentous structures indicative of Actinomyces israelii.
